title: How to Make a Very Berry Trifle

steps.headline: Line the bottom of the glass dish with the sponge fingers evenly so that the entire bottom and sides of the dish are covered, leaving about two inches uncovered at the top of the dish.
steps.description: This is to form a sort of 'edible bowl' and make it easier to serve. This step is optional, but highly recommended, and could be replaced with flat meringue or even digestive biscuits.

steps.headline: Make up the jelly as per instructions.
Mix in the berries with the jelly so that they are evenly spread throughout the bowl.
Put the dish into a fridge until the jelly solidifies into jelly rather than liquid.
steps.description: This takes some time and you could skip ahead a couple of steps and whip the cream during this time.

steps.headline: Once the jelly is set, evenly pour the custard over the jelly and smooth with a spoon so it is smooth.
Put the mix into the fridge to let the jelly solidify, at least on top.
Put the 500ml of double cream into your blender and blend it until it is thick, white and puffy.
steps.description: If it turns a pale yellow and goes grainy, you have gone to far and the cream is not usable for this recipe.

steps.headline: Spread the cream over the custard evenly, making sure it is spread totally evenly so that there is an equal amount of cream all over.
Put in the fridge until serving.

text: Line the bottom of the glass dish with the sponge fingers evenly so that the entire bottom and sides of the dish are covered, leaving about two inches uncovered at the top of the dish. This is to form a sort of 'edible bowl' and make it easier to serve. This step is optional, but highly recommended, and could be replaced with flat meringue or even digestive biscuits. Make up the jelly as per instructions.  Mix in the berries with the jelly so that they are evenly spread throughout the bowl.  Put the dish into a fridge until the jelly solidifies into jelly rather than liquid. This takes some time and you could skip ahead a couple of steps and whip the cream during this time. Once the jelly is set, evenly pour the custard over the jelly and smooth with a spoon so it is smooth.  Put the mix into the fridge to let the jelly solidify, at least on top.  Put the 500ml of double cream into your blender and blend it until it is thick, white and puffy. If it turns a pale yellow and goes grainy, you have gone to far and the cream is not usable for this recipe. Spread the cream over the custard evenly, making sure it is spread totally evenly so that there is an equal amount of cream all over.  Put in the fridge until serving.  Finished.
